highlights: Support our platform CI/CD pipelines including Jenkins scripts, terragrunt config, ArgoCD deployments, Helm Charts and Kustomize manifests
Maintain and create new terraform modules as needed to automate workflows and reduce manual, error-prone toil
Contribute to our monitoring stack by creating new Grafana dashboards and alerts, defined in code (Prometheus + Grafana + Cortex, Python)
Contributed new features and bug fixes to our internal TUI/CLI tool (golang)
Maintenance and support of our Azure Infrastructure including linux and Windows VMs and all supporting Azure services
Work with our internal FinOps team to reduce cloud operating costs by modifying terraform modules
Support, manage and maintain production and pre-production kubernetes clusters using various tools, including kops, terraform, helm, k9s
Maintain terraform modules, helm charts, ruby scripts and supporting CI/CD infrastructure (custom GitHub actions, ArgoCD, Vault, terragrunt)
Collaborate with engineering team to deploy new k8s features to improve service uptime and security
Continuously improve monitoring and alerting to ensure platform availability and uptime (Grafana + Prometheus + TICK stack)
Led incident response and RCA for production-related incidents and devise action plan
Assisted with hiring by conducted interviews for SRE roles as needed
Assisted customers with end-to-end deployment of CloudBees CI to kubernetes (AWS EKS, GKS, Azure, self-hosted) via live screen-sharing sessions (and email)
Support customers during critical system outages by providing accurate, timely problem diagnoses and clear resolution steps
Manage a backlog of customer support requests ranging from diagnosing complex technical issues to recommending CI/CD best practices
Report bugs and collaborate with engineering to test and deliver fixes
Contribute to customer-facing knowledge base and improve product documentation
Replaced ad-hoc homegrown bash scripts with terraform for provisioning libvirt-based virtual machines on system Z
Converted chef recipes to ansible playbooks
Perform root-cause analysis on various network, storage, and virtualization related-bugs using linux shell utilities (tcpdump, ptrace, etc)
Collaborated with IBM KVM development team to plan and prioritize upcoming test cycle
Helped educate teammates on modern infrastucture-as-code tools (ansible, terraform, docker) with hands-on workshops and documentation
Developed, maintained, and supported two z/OS system APIs: an HTTP client library (C code), and a backend API for automating system Z hardware configuration (various languages)
As iteration manager, facilitated daily stand-ups, user story sessions, design discussions, and retrospectives
Developed a CLI application (in C) to generate and run tests against HTTP/JSON client library
Led migration from manual build process to automated CI pipeline (RTCBuild with Jenkins) resulting in improved code quality and a streamlined developer experience

keywords: python, terraform, github, AWS alb + nlb
projects.name: ALB Terraform Module v6 to v9 Upgrade
projects.description: We used a OSS terraform module to manage all of our customer facing load balancers. We needed to upgrade to v9 to ensure we could continue to use terraform to manage these LBs.  Otherwise, we'd have to manually manage sensitive configuration for over four dozen customer facing load balancers. This required creating a python script to automate changes to the terraform state to ensure zero customer downtime.

projects.name: Kubernetes upgrade from 1.14 to 1.23
projects.description: All of our clusters for the Supply Chain Platform were running a (grossly) outdated version of k8s (1.14). I led the upgrade to a supported version (1.23) ensuring minimal downtime. I also (painstakingly) documented the upgrade progress for future SREs
